lines.text: Alone in my garden I heard the cry of wind and wave. I came hurrying fast - and he was here!
Beware of this stranger! The sea is treacherous. His coming bodes no good!
Perhaps it was the Springtime - but the girl seemed very beautiful in the boy's eyes - and so he had lingered on.
How would you like to go to America, Lotus Flower?
You take me to those United States? Christian lady at Mission tell me America fine place. Women free - can spend all husband's money.
The garden knew she loved him, for her laughter stirred the rose leaves.
Surely you don't believe you're in love with her?
Why not? She's sweet and charming - and different...
That's just it, Allen; she is different...
We will have what you call in American a-a- - is it a great lark or great sparrow you call those good times in America?
Oh, my husband, I love you so! If you no come back to me, you make my heart go dead.
At the foot of the garden waited the restless sea.
